title: Article 22 Spanish Civil Code – Minimum Continuous Legal Residence
passage: Standard rule: 10 years’ legal, continuous residence immediately before filing. Reduced periods: 5 years for refugees; 2 years for nationals of Latin-American countries, Andorra, Portugal, the Philippines, Equatorial Guinea, or persons of Sephardic origin; 1 year for special cases (born in Spain, married to a Spaniard ≥ 1 y, widowers, or those under Spanish guardianship ≥ 2 y). Residence must be lawful and uninterrupted.

title: Fast-Track Citizenship for Ibero-American & Treaty Nationals
passage: Citizens of 20+ Ibero-American states plus Andorra, Portugal, the Philippines and Equatorial Guinea may apply for citizenship after only 2 years’ residence and can keep their original nationality. Absences > 3 months can break continuity; language (DELE A2) and CCSE civics exams still required.

title: CCSE Civics Exam – Cost & Logistics
passage: The Instituto Cervantes CCSE (constitutional & sociocultural knowledge) test costs €85. Fee covers two attempts within 18 months, official prep materials, and digital result certificate. Held the last Thursday of every month (except Aug & Dec) with two sittings: 18:00 & 20:00.

title: Language Requirement – DELE A2 Spanish Exam
passage: Unless exempt (e.g., nationals of Spanish-speaking countries), applicants must pass the DELE A2 exam to prove basic language competence. Cost ranges €108–€220 depending on test centre; one attempt per fee; preparation materials provided by Instituto Cervantes.

title: Core Documentation for Citizenship Application
passage: Typical dossier: recent full-form birth certificate, valid passport + NIE, police clearance from each country lived in, proof of legal residence (padron & TIE history), health-insurance evidence, marriage/divorce certificates where applicable, DELE A2 & CCSE certificates, and Modelo 790 fee receipt.

title: Five-Step Jobbatical Client Journey
passage: 1) Eligibility audit; 2) Bespoke document & apostille guidance; 3) Digital preparation and compliant e-filing via Jobbatical platform; 4) Real-time status tracking with dedicated agent chat; 5) Citizenship approval & celebration. Family members resident ≥ 2 y can be added to the same case.

title: Life-Changing Benefits of Holding Spanish Citizenship
passage: Spanish passport enables visa-free or visa-on-arrival access to 189+ countries, unrestricted live/work rights across the EU/EEA, eligibility for public healthcare (SNS), free or low-cost education, EU voting rights, and simplified property or business setup inside the single market.

title: Dual Nationality Rules – Who Can Keep Original Passport
passage: Spain allows dual nationality without renunciation for citizens of Latin-American countries, Andorra, Portugal, the Philippines and Equatorial Guinea, plus those of Sephardic descent. Other nationals must generally renounce unless covered by future bilateral treaties.

title: Including Spouse & Children in the Application
passage: Spouses and minor children meeting the same residence period (usually 2 years for fast-track categories) can join a principal applicant’s file. Jobbatical offers bundled family packages, synchronising document prep and registry appointments for all dependants.

title: Official e-Filing Portal – Ministerio de Justicia
passage: All residence-based nationality applications are submitted via the Ministry of Justice e-portal (sede.mjusticia.gob.es). The process is 100 % electronic, from uploading PDFs to receiving resolutions, under Order JUS/1625/2016 which shortened processing times.

title: Jobbatical Dashboard – Real-Time Case Tracking
passage: Clients log in anytime to view milestone updates, pending tasks, and estimated decision dates. Push notifications flag when additional documents are needed or when the Ministry of Justice issues new status codes (e.g., ‘En Calificación’).

title: Jobbatical Refund & Cancellation Policy
passage: Full refund if cancelled within 24 h of purchase; 75 % after initial agent guidance; 25 % after document pack issued; zero refund once the application is filed with Spanish authorities. A 14-day legal cooling-off period applies under Spanish consumer law.

title: Certificado de Concordancia – Linking NIE & DNI After Naturalisation
passage: New citizens should request this police-issued certificate to match their former NIE with their new DNI, preventing banking, tax and property record mismatches. Apply at the Policía Nacional with form EX-15 and Modelo 790-012 (~€7 fee).

title: Common Application Pitfalls & How Jobbatical Solves Them
passage: Frequent issues: outdated padrón certificates (> 90 days), untranslated foreign documents, missing apostilles, and long absences breaking residence continuity. Jobbatical’s checklist, sworn-translator network and automated reminders cut rejection risk.

title: Stay Compliant – Jobbatical Residence Permit Renewal
passage: For clients not yet eligible for citizenship, Jobbatical renews TIE cards and work or study permits, ensuring no legal-status gap. Permanent residents renew every 4-5 years; temporary permits every 1-2 years, per 2025 regulations.

title: EU/EEA Citizens – NIE Registration After 90 Days
passage: While EU citizens enter Spain visa-free, those staying > 90 days must obtain an NIE, register at the town hall (padrón) and apply for the EU Registry Certificate. Jobbatical guides HR teams on fast scheduling and family follow-ups.

title: Government Fees & Mandatory Tests Snapshot
passage: Nationality application fee: €60–€104 (Modelo 790-026). CCSE civics: €85 with one free retake. DELE A2: €108–€220 depending on centre. Misc. costs: translations, apostilles, and police certificates vary by country.
